docs.text:
Introduction


Welcome to the TrueSight Pulse Python API
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Welcome to the TrueSight Pulse Python API
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text:
Using


The TrueSight Pulse API for Python is easy to use and obviates the need to understand REST and JSON.
Those already familar with Python will be generating new measurements into TrueSight Pulse in minutes.


Installation


$ pip install tspapi




Example


First import the Python package that contains the API


import tspapi




Next allocate an instance of 
API
 class. The TrueSight Pulse APIs require an e-mail
and the API token associated with the account. Credentials can be added programmatically
as shown here:


api = tspapi.API(email='joe@example.com', api_tokens='api.f8843b57e9-7482')




or omitted if you set the the 
TSP_EMAIL
 and 
TSP_API_TOKEN
 with e-mail and API token
respectively:


api = tspapi.API()




Call the api in this example the creation


Exceptions

docs.title: Example

docs.text:
Metrics


Metrics
 are


metric_create


metric_create_batch(metric=None,
                    display_name=None,
                    display_name_short=None,
                    description=None,
                    default_aggregate='avg',
                    default_resolution=1000,
                    unit='number',
                    disable=False)




Example


import tspapi

api = tspapi.API()
api.metric_create(name='Foo',
                  display_name='Foo',
                  display_name_Short='Foo'
                  description='A story about foo',
                  default_aggregate='max',
                  default_resolution=5000,
                  unit='percent',
                  disabled=False)





metric_create_batch


metric_create_batch(measurements)

docs.text:
import tspapi

api = tspapi.API()
api.metric_create(name='Foo',
                  display_name='Foo',
                  display_name_Short='Foo'
                  description='A story about foo',
                  default_aggregate='max',
                  default_resolution=5000,
                  unit='percent',
                  disabled=False)
